turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Polish census of 1931.
turn.1: What was the outcome of the Polish census of 1931?
turn.2: Polish census of 1931 The Polish census of 1931 or Second General Census in Poland () was the second census taken in sovereign Poland during the interwar period, performed on December 9, 1931 by the Main Bureau of Statistics.
turn.4: It established that Poland's population amounted to 32 million people (over 5 million more than in the previous census of 1921).
turn.6: The census was organised following the rules established by an act of the Polish Parliament of October 14, 1931.
turn.7: What is the most important fact in the article?
turn.8: In contrast to earlier census of 1921, the 1931 census did not count national minorities and detailed information on types of farms, leaving only the question of the overall area of land owned by the citizen.
turn.9: What did you find to be the most interesting fact?
turn.10: The part related to education was expanded to include questions of ability to read and write.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: The results of the census were being published in 39 volumes between 1936 and 1939 in a publishing series "Statistics of Poland".
